exception WrapperSlr.Error¶

Bases: WrapperSlr.Error

Exception raised for errors while parsing

message – explanation of the error
exception WrapperSlr.UsageError(message)¶

Bases: WrapperSlr.Error

Exception raised for errors while starting

message – explanation of the error
class WrapperSlr.SlrResult¶

Bases: WrapperSlr.Result

result of an SLR run.

class WrapperSlr.SlrResultSite(residue, lneutral, loptimal, w, statistic, pvalue, adjusted_pvalue, result, warning, note, is_synonymous)¶

Bases: WrapperSlr.Result

result with site specific information.

mResult can be either -,– for negatively selected sites 0 for neutral sites +,++ for positively selected sites None for sites, which can’t be estimated: gapped sites/synonymous sites/etc.

isNegative(threshold=0.05, use_adjusted=False)¶

returns true, if site is under negative selection.

isPositive(threshold=0.05, use_adjusted=False)¶

returns true, if site is under positive selection.

class WrapperSlr.Slr¶
GetOptions()¶

return options in pretty format

WriteAlignment(mali)¶

write alignment in Phylip format.

WriteTree(tree)¶

write tree to file.

BuildMap(mali)¶

build map of identifiers. SLR requires the taxa in the tree to be identical to the position (not the name) in the multiple alignment file (and not the ids). Thus choose sequential numbering for ids.

parseOutput(lines, lines_log=None)¶

parse Slr output.

if lines_log is given, the output from the logfile is parsed as well.

parseLog(lines, result)¶

parse log file.

parseSites(lines, result)¶

parse sites file.

seems to be fixed with format. Note, there seems to be a warning field between Result and Note without a heading.

WrapperSlr.getOptions(options)¶

translate command line options to PAML options.
